critique: The executive order is a technical document that extends the reporting deadline of the President's Advisory Panel on Federal Tax Reform. It is unlikely to evoke strong emotions. The order is not intended to create any right or benefit, so it is unlikely to evoke joy or sadness. The order is not controversial, so it is unlikely to evoke anger, fear, disgust, or surprise. The order is a routine administrative action, so it is unlikely to evoke any strong emotions.
